pleaseConnectWallet: Please connect your wallet to view your recent transactions

errorMessages.tokenAlreadyAdded: Token with this address already added
errorMessages.tokenNotWhitelisted:
Warning! This token is not whitelisted.
By adding it as a custom token, you confirm that all further interactions with it are at your own risk.
errorMessages.routingThroughTokens: Routing through these tokens resulted in the best price for your trade.
errorMessages.importTokenWarning:
Anyone can create an BEP20 token on BSC with any name, including creating fake versions of existing tokens and tokens that claim to represent projects that do not have a token.
This interface can load arbitrary tokens by token addresses. Please take extra caution and do your research when interacting with arbitrary BEP20 tokens.
errorMessages.importTokenWarningPurchase: If you purchase an arbitrary token,
errorMessages.youMaybeUnable: you may be unable to sell it back.

questionHelperMessages.transactionRevert: Your transaction will revert if the price changes unfavorably by more than this percentage.
questionHelperMessages.transactionRevertPending: Your transaction will revert if it is pending for more than this long.
questionHelperMessages.findTokenBySearching: Find a token by searching for its name or symbol or by pasting its address below.
questionHelperMessages.transactionWillRevert: Your transaction will revert if there is a large, unfavorable price movement before it is confirmed.
questionHelperMessages.differenceBetweenMarket: The difference between the market price and your price due to trade size.
questionHelperMessages.feeTreasury: For each trade a 0.25% fee is paid. 0.20% goes to liquidity providers and 0.05% goes to the GravisSwap treasury.
questionHelperMessages.toolToFindPairs: Use this tool to find pairs that don't automatically appear in the interface
questionHelperMessages.addLiquidity: When you add liquidity, you are given pool tokens representing your position. These tokens automatically earn fees proportional to your share of the pool, and can be redeemed at any time.
questionHelperMessages.removeTokens: Removing pool tokens converts your position back into underlying tokens at the current rate, proportional to your share of the pool. Accrued fees are included in the amounts you receive.
